aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Competitive Landscape
Amazon faces rapidly evolving and intensely competitive businesses.
Amazon has many competitors across geographies.
Amazon faces cross-border competition.
Amazon has competitors in different industries.
Amazon's competitors include physical retail businesses.
Amazon's competitors include e-commerce retail businesses.
Amazon's competitors include omnichannel retail businesses.
Amazon's competitors include e-commerce services businesses.
Amazon's competitors include web computing services businesses.
Amazon's competitors include infrastructure computing services businesses.
Amazon's competitors include electronic devices businesses.
Amazon's competitors include digital content businesses.
Amazon's competitors include advertising businesses.
Amazon's competitors include grocery businesses.
Amazon's competitors include healthcare businesses.
Amazon's competitors include communications businesses.
Amazon's competitors include transportation services businesses.
Amazon's competitors include logistics services businesses.
Some of Amazon's current competitors have greater resources than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's potential competitors have greater resources than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's current competitors have longer histories than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's potential competitors have longer histories than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's current competitors have more customers than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's potential competitors have more customers than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's current competitors have greater brand recognition than Amazon.
Some of Amazon's potential competitors have greater brand recognition than Amazon.
Amazon's competitors have greater brand recognition particularly with Amazon's newly-launched products.
Amazon's competitors have greater brand recognition particularly with Amazon's newly-launched services.
Amazon's competitors have greater brand recognition particularly in Amazon's newer geographic regions.
Amazon's competitors may secure better terms from vendors.
Amazon's competitors may adopt more aggressive pricing.
Amazon's competitors may devote more resources to technology.
Amazon's competitors may devote more resources to infrastructure.
Amazon's competitors may devote more resources to fulfillment.
Amazon's competitors may devote more resources to marketing.
Competition continues to intensify for Amazon.
Competition intensifies with the development of new business models.
Competition intensifies with the entry of new competitors.
Competition intensifies with the entry of well-funded competitors.
Amazon's competitors enter into business combinations.
Amazon's competitors enter into alliances.
Established companies in other market segments expand to become competitive with Amazon's business.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/

text:
##### We Face Intense Competition

Our businesses are rapidly evolving and intensely competitive, and we have many competitors across geographies, including cross-border competition, and in different industries, including physical, e-commerce, and omnichannel retail, e-commerce services, web and infrastructure computing services, electronic devices, digital content, advertising, grocery, healthcare, communications, and transportation and logistics services. Some of our current and potential competitors have greater resources, longer histories, more customers, and/or greater brand recognition, particularly with our newly-launched products and services and in our newer geographic regions. They may secure better terms from vendors, adopt more aggressive pricing, and devote more resources to technology, infrastructure, fulfillment, and marketing.

Competition continues to intensify, including with the development of new business models and the entry of new and well-funded competitors, and as our competitors enter into business combinations or alliances and established companies in other market segments expand to become competitive with our business.
